title: Cambridge Platonism: Cudworth, More & Smith
description: The Cambridge Platonists' integration of Platonic philosophy with Christian theology and early modern natural philosophy, defending spiritual reality against materialism and mechanism.

books.title: Essay on Passions and Moral Sense (1728)
books.author: Francis Hutcheson

keyFigures: Henry More (1614-1687): Defense of spiritual substance, 'Spirit of Nature', influenced Newton's absolute space
John Smith (1618-1652): Mystical-rational theology, 'deiformity' of soul, died young but hugely influential
Shaftesbury (1671-1713): Moral sense philosophy, natural harmony between virtue and happiness
Francis Hutcheson (1694-1746): Systematic moral sense theory, influenced Adam Smith (his teacher)
researchValue: The Cambridge Platonists synthesized Renaissance Neoplatonism with Christian theology and responded to Hobbes's materialism. Their defense of innate ideas and spiritual substance influenced both Enlightenment philosophy and Romantic thought. Essential bridge to Adam Smith's moral philosophy.
